jobDescription: Job Title  Assistant Facility Manager - STRTP  Position  ID 27017949 Duration  Location  San Jose,  CA 95126 Other Location  DescriptionOVERVIEW: Under the direction of the Assistant Director, provides supervision to staff and support to the therapeutic environment/setting and treatment of all residents to ensure compliance with program goals and maintain optimal care of clients in the programs in the evenings. As part of the treatment team, job performance contributes to the short and long term goals for residents in the Residential Program. Performance of the typical responsibilities and duties requires the ability to perform the job duties, supervision of residential staff and residents (24/7 operation), and communication with others involving job-related matters generally of moderate complexity. DIRECT REPORTS:Residential Counselor – Group HomesQUALIFICATIONS:RequiredBasic skills in crisis interventions, suicidal assessment, conflict resolution and interpersonal communicationBachelor’s degree in Behavioral or Social Sciences or equivalent experience.Basic knowledge of childcare practice with SED children (i.e. Special Education, Group Home, or Probation/Juvenile Hall) in either day treatment or residential careAbility to maintain a positive perspective in the treatment and care of emotionally disturbed youthDemonstrated ability to lead and direct staff and foster team buildingAbility to produce well-written documentationAbility to work independently in high stress environmentDemonstrated dedication to youth through leadership and/or mentoring experiencesPreferred3 years’ experience working with at-risk youth or adolescent children in a residential setting preferred but not requiredRESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE (but not limited to):Supervises and develops overall Childcare staff; provides coaching and mentoring in weak or problem areas with individual residential counselors or teams as necessary. Meets weekly with each counselor to review and observe job performance and provide support (including overnight and weekend staff), coordinates 24 hours of onsite one-on-one training using the counselor Training ManualParticipate in monthly team meetings with Social Worker, Clinician, Program Manager, Probation Officer, SA Counselor and other staff/providers to review treatment progress and identify areas for improvement and interventions.Responsible for administrative functions; weekly supervision of time cards (controlling overtime hours by cutting back or adding on to individual shifts), develops monthly residential childcare activity/program calendar, weekly facility and van checklist, incident reports, records of nutrition program, oversees dispensing of medication and reviews medication logs, keeps records and submits purchase request w/receipts for expenditures and operates home within daily budget.Establish and maintains residents binder and personal files for house documentation.Supervises all aspects of licensing requirements, records keeping, supplies, and auto and house maintenance.Manages and ensures transportation to residents’ doctors and all other appointments.Facilitates school entrance, monitors attendance and performance and elevates issues to treatment teams for resolution.Oversee childcare home visits and family visits to facility.Interacts with HR in the hiring and evaluation process of staff; conducting interviews, evaluates staff and coordinates training and development of staff.Acts as a liaison between administrative and counseling staff.Responsible for supporting agency Policies and Procedures regarding assessment, treatment planning, and treatment modalitiesCarries out directions, decision, philosophy, and administrative methods as established by Executive Direction.Other duties as assigned.ESSENTIAL DUTIES: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. Ability to read and interpret documents and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondenceAbility to speak effectively before groups of students or employees of organizationAbility to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situationsAbility to identify negative disruptive behaviors and redirect behavior using mediation techniquesWhile performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop; kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; taste or smell.The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.The employee may be required to make and/or receive physical contact in the process of delivering First Aid/CPR or Handle with Care, or in training to those methods.Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.Ability to get CPR and First Aid certificate within 30 days of start date, and maintain a current certificateMust clear a Department of Justice (DOJ) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background check including fingerprinting before start date and maintain clearanceMust clear a health screening, including TB before start date and maintain clearanceMust be at least 21 years of age and able to work in a Community Care Licensed FacilityMust be able to drive, have a valid driver’s license, clean driving record and maintain a clean driving record.Meet and maintain the minimum vehicle liability and property insurance limits (in order to be insured by our insurance carrier for transportation of residents) Openings  1
